docs.snippet: For 30 years, the Huskies enjoyed the drama and rivalries of a conference tournament at Madison Square Garden. In Memphis this season, they have faced a tough adjustment....
docs.lead_paragraph: For 30 years, the Huskies enjoyed the drama and rivalries of a conference tournament at Madison Square Garden. In Memphis this season, they have faced a tough adjustment.
docs.abstract: University of Connecticut men's basketball team has faced a tough transition to the American Athletic Conference tournament after enjoying the drama and rivalries of the Big East tournament at Madison Square Garden for past 30 years; coach Jim Calhoun recalls some of team's most memorable experiences at the Garden.

headline.main: In Land of Elvis, UConn Still Yearns for Broadway
headline.print_headline: In Land of Elvis, UConn Still Yearns for Broadway

docs.snippet: The agreement would bring the college basketball powerhouses Duke, North Carolina and Syracuse to Barclays Center for at least two March tournaments starting in 2017....
docs.lead_paragraph: The agreement would bring the college basketball powerhouses Duke, North Carolina and Syracuse to Barclays Center for at least two March tournaments starting in 2017.
docs.abstract: Atlantic Coast Conference will hold its men’s basketball tournament at Barclays Center in Brooklyn in 2017 and 2018, setting up conference tournament showdown with the Big East, which is held simultaneously at Madison Square Garden.

headline.main: A.C.C. Tournament Said to Be Heading to Brooklyn in 2017
headline.print_headline: A.C.C. Tournament Said to Be Heading to Brooklyn in 2017

byline.original: By VIV BERNSTEIN and ZACH SCHONBRUN

docs.snippet: Coach Jim Boeheim was jeered when he was introduced on Friday, and then the second-seeded Orange fell to No. 7 North Carolina State, 66-63, in their first Atlantic Coast Conference tournament....
docs.lead_paragraph: Coach Jim Boeheim was jeered when he was introduced on Friday, and then the second-seeded Orange fell to No. 7 North Carolina State, 66-63, in their first Atlantic Coast Conference tournament.
docs.abstract: North Carolina State beats Syracuse, 66-63, in Syracuse's first Atlantic Coast Conference tournament; Syracuse has lost five of its past seven games, foundering after a 25-0 season opening.

headline.main: In A.C.C. Tournament, Syracuse Cannot Find Allies or the Basket
headline.print_headline: In A.C.C. Tournament, Syracuse Cannot Find Allies or the Basket

docs.snippet: The Bonnies trailed the Billikens, the tournament’s top seed, by 10 points at halftime, but they rallied behind a swarming defense and 3-point shooting to take a 71-68 victory....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bonnies trailed the Billikens, the tournament’s top seed, by 10 points at halftime, but they rallied behind a swarming defense and 3-point shooting to take a 71-68 victory.
docs.abstract: College Basketball Men's Tournament Roundup; St Bonaventure upsets St Louis, 71-68, in the Atlantic 10 tournament quarterfinals; other men's college basketball news noted.

headline.main: One 3-Pointer Topples St. Louis, While Many Doom Kansas
headline.print_headline: One 3-Pointer Topples St. Louis, While Many Doom Kansas

docs.snippet: A crisis strikes the heart of basketball country: For the first time in nearly a decade, none of Indiana’s Division I men’s teams have made the N.C.A.A. tournament....
docs.lead_paragraph: A crisis strikes the heart of basketball country: For the first time in nearly a decade, none of Indiana’s Division I men’s teams have made the N.C.A.A. tournament.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column notes that none of Indiana's 10 Division 1 men's teams have made the NCAA basketball tournament, marking crisis for the heart of basketball country; holds that conference realignment is only part of the problem.

headline.main: For Land of Hoops, No Shot in N.C.A.A. Tournament
headline.print_headline: For Land of Hoops, No Shot in the Biggest Tournament

docs.snippet: Many college conferences stage postseason basketball tournaments in Las Vegas, but the N.C.A.A., concerned about gambling, has long refused to place any of its tournament games in the city....
docs.lead_paragraph: Many college conferences stage postseason basketball tournaments in Las Vegas, but the N.C.A.A., concerned about gambling, has long refused to place any of its tournament games in the city.
docs.abstract: NCAA has long refused to hold its tournament games in Las Vegas, citing strict opposition to gambling, despite fact that city is a perfect fit for the events; most leagues in the Pacific and Mountain time zones choose to have their postseason tournaments in Las Vegas, creating a strange inconsistency for fans, coaches and administrators.

headline.main: A City of Madness, Bypassed by the N.C.A.A.
headline.print_headline: A City of Madness, Bypassed by the N.C.A.A.
